intro: Frasera gypsicola, commonly known as the gypsum frasera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the family Gelsemiaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils, often found in areas with high mineral content such as gypsum deposits. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are clustered in terminal racemes. Frasera gypsicola is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
